text: Frozen Wonders
End of the Earth:The North and South Poles
Are you already guessing?
Do you know where the North and South Poles are?
That’s right!
The answer is easy but not simple.
THE ARCTIC is in the northernmost region of the Earth.
The North Pole is at the very top of the Earth.
The North Pole is in the Arctic Ocean.
It sits in a big, white, and icy ocean.
ANTARCTICA is the Earth’s southernmost continent.
The South Pole is at the very bottom of the Earth.
The South Pole is on ANTARCTICA.
It sits on a big, white, and icy island.
Wrap up warm and grab your mittens!
There's no doubt!
We’re off on an icy adventure.

Wrap up warm and grab your mittens!

We’re off on an icy adventure.
Frozen wonders!
Top of the World: Exploring the Arctic
Eight countries are partly in the Arctic.
People live at the edges of the Arctic Ocean.
Some are called ‘Inuit.’
They wear many layers of clothes.
hey weigh around 4?.
They often go fishing for salmon.
Also, many animals live in the Arctic.
Polar bears, whales, Arctic foxes, walruses, and seals love the cold.
The official name for the Northern Lights is Aurora Borealis.
The official name for the Southern Lights is Aurora Australis.
What a breathtaking sight!
Sometimes at night, the sky is full of dancing curtains.
These colorful lights are called auroras.

hey weigh around 4?.

Frozen wonders!
Bottom of the World:Discovering the Antarctic
The South Pole is colder than the North Pole.
It can get as cold as -89°C. Brrr!
The land of the South Pole is called ‘Antarctica.’
Antarctica is the coldest, driest, and highest continent.
A glistening ice sheet covers nearly all of Antarctica.
About 2% of Antarctica is ice-free.
The higher you climb in Antarctica, the colder the air gets.
No people live in the Antarctic.
But scientists stay there to study.
They watch how Antarctica is changing.
And you can find lots of penguins standing upright.
They look like handsome gentlemen.
But penguins comically waddle when they walk.
